newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France drains 2.1 bln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France drains 2.1 bln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France drained 2.1 billion francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Monday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Tuesday.
It accepted bids for 40.1 billion francs in new liquidity, 2.1 billion less than the 42.2 billion leaving the market on Tuesday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on September 24.
The Bank of France said it allocated 12.2 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 3.0 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 27.9 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 11.5 percent of this demand.
